definitions.definition: the special set of clothes worn by all members of an organization or a group at work, or by children at school

examples.text: The hat is part of the **school uniform**.
He was **dressed in the uniform** of a Royal Navy officer.
the uniform of the Parachute Regiment
He quickly put on his uniform.
The limousine was driven by a chauffeur in uniform.
She was wearing the regulation uniform of tunic, hat and tie.
men and women who don military uniform to defend their country
A man in a uniform stopped us entering.

definitions.definition: the clothes worn by the members of a sports team when they are playing

examples.text: the team’s **away uniform** *(= that they use when playing games away from home)*

definitions.definition: the type of clothes that a person or group usually wears

examples.text: my standard teenage uniform of sweatshirt and jeans
They wore the standard uniform of the American office worker.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (as an adjective): from French uniforme or Latin uniformis (see uni-, form). The current sense of the noun dates from the mid 18th cent.
